text: Daniel Dominik Kaiser-Küblböck (born Daniel Dominik Küblböck; 27 August 1985 – 9 September 2018) was a German pop singer. His popularity came from late 2002 until 2004. He was known for appearing in the first season of Deutschland sucht den Superstar (DSDS), the German version of Pop Idol, in which he came third. In 2005, Küblböck appeared in the German version of Big Brother, and in 2015, he took part in the eighth season of the German version of Let's Dance, where he finished sixth. == Personal life and disappearance == In 2010, Küblböck came out as gay. Before his disappearance, he opened up about possibly transitioning into a woman. He began using the name Lana Kaiser. Küblböck was reported missing on 9 September 2018 after falling overboard at a cruise ship on the Labrador Sea near Newfoundland and Labrador, Canada. The Canadian coast guard started a search operation on site and assisting. On 10 September 2018, the coast guard abandoned its search due to the slim chance of survival in the cold water. ==References== ==Other websites== * Official Homepage of Daniel Küblböck * Official Fan Club of Daniel Küblböck * Official Myspace of Daniel Küblböck * Category:1985 births Category:2018 deaths Category:Missing people Category:German pop singers Category:German movie actors Category:German television actors Category:German LGBT people Category:LGBT actors Category:LGBT singers Category:Gay men Category:People declared dead in absentia Category:Entertainers from Bavaria
title: Daniel Küblböck
